trans-unit.source: Based on feedback, we’ve made authoring class-based DSC resources simpler and easier to understand.
trans-unit.target: Based on feedback, we’ve made authoring class-based DSC resources simpler and easier to understand.

trans-unit.source: The major differences between a class-based DSC resource and a cmdlet DSC resource provider are:
trans-unit.target: The major differences between a class-based DSC resource and a cmdlet DSC resource provider are:

trans-unit.source: A MOF file for the schema is not required.
trans-unit.target: A MOF file for the schema is not required.

trans-unit.source: A **DSCResource** subfolder in the module folder is not required.
trans-unit.target: A **DSCResource** subfolder in the module folder is not required.

trans-unit.source: A PowerShell module file can contain multiple DSC resource classes.
trans-unit.target: A PowerShell module file can contain multiple DSC resource classes.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Writing a custom DSC resource with PowerShell classes](https://msdn.microsoft.com/powershell/dsc/authoringresource).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Writing a custom DSC resource with PowerShell classes](https://msdn.microsoft.com/powershell/dsc/authoringresource).
